interestingcomments.content: Consider that a theoretical curved (really concave spherical or parabolic) sensor, if even possible would be totally unsuitable for M lenses which project an image onto a flat field. Which is why I was wondering about Ricoh style modules (and not for the M, but for a new system camera). I think you have to think through what kind of manufacturing facility would be required to make such a sensor, compare that to other solutions, and also consider that it would require a complete line of lenses designed just for it. The additional depth of a camera would be the least of the problems. I'm not espousing that Leica should do this for the M. I think whatever issues can be resolved with a firmware update, should be resolved with it. I like the way the M system works, and hope Leica doesn't deviate from it. If they want to introduce a new and separate system that's fine with me (though I think we agree that Leica won't be doing so any time soon). I'm jus curious about what is realistically possible if a company, say Sony, were to develop and introduce a new system.* *I don't think Sony will be I introducing and maintaining three separate lines of interchangeable lens camera and lens systems.

interestingcomments.content: Hello. I figured I would introduce myself. I am a part-time professional photographer (weddings and portraits). I have always wanted a Leica. Some days I am tempted to sell my bag of pro Nikon gear, give up weddings, and get an M-system. However, I do enjoy shooting weddings and need the DSLR to do it properly IMHO. Anyway, my wife just purchased an X1 for me as a gift (black) and I am anxiously awaiting the arrival of this new camera. I wanted a nice compact camera to carry around because a Nikon D3 (even the D600) can be too heavy...especially with good glass. I was thinking about the X100, but the body is only 1/4 the value of a camera. Glass is where the quality is and Leica is known for their lenses. Anyway, I hope I like the X1 and I am sure it will be a gateway drug leading me to want an M9, etc. soon. Don't let me do anything too crazy here! Feel free to take a look at my site. Chris

interestingcomments.content: After months of reading I might as well introduce myself. Hobby photographer to clear up my mind and forget about work for a moment. Used to be a "Canon" guy with a 5D2 and L lenses. Somehow I was never completely satisfied so apart from a telezoom L I got rid of the other L lenses. Replaced them with a 1,4/50 and a 2,8/21 ZE which are much more to my taste. Rediscovered the fun of analog photography with Minolta A5 rangefinder and bought myself a Hasselblad 501cm. Hold on, I haven't finished this post, yet. Went to Singapore with it for a couple of days and it proofed a bit of a handfull walking all day with a Hassy and a tripod. In a very short time I have added an M6 with 35mm Summicron IV and later on came the 50 Summicron. Just recently added an MP to the 'fleet'. --img--  Not sure if I'm going to keep my dslr gear or if I'm going to trade it in for a digital M in time. Guess I'm getting very hooked to this brand.
